name: Drinking Water at UHWI
highlight: Water distribution in Jamaica is uneven. Government estimates the shortfall at 126 million cubic meters/yr. Water lock offs are frequent, this secures clean drinking water for the children's ward of the hospital and brings new solutions to the country.

name: Phase 1: Solar Panel Assembly
highlight: Caribbean nations need to install 320 MW of RE per year at a cost of $1.2 billion. Prior to this project most of that spend would be external, this project would provide internal collaboration, energy security, jobs and management of their supply chain.

name: Electric Urban Tours
highlight: This project pioneers electric urban tours in Belize City with Fun Utility Vehicles (FUVs) with planned expansion to Jamaica and Barbados, aiming to revolutionize sustainable transportation in the Caribbean.

name: Phase 2: Build Caribbean Blended Finance for Resilience (CBFR) Fund
highlight: A regional blended financial fund to build climate resilient infrastructure

name: Regenerating the Blue Forests of the Caribbean (Phase 1)
highlight: The objective is to build a community of interest and action around a mangrove forest-focused blue carbon initiative for the Caribbean, kicking off with a shared learning journey to engage philanthropists and interested parties to start a fund.

name: Re-Sat & WARN: Environmental and Energy Analysis (Phase 1 - Pilot)
highlight: Suriname was 2nd in the world to update its NDC including generating 35% RE. This project provides a free new software solution to aid them in establishing their energy mix while assisting IEA in developing their business in the region.

name: Climate-Smart Agriculture - Fork Farms (Anguilla)
highlight: Anguilla Govt is seeking to establish Controlled Environment Agriculture to enhance crop production & food security while addressing water scarcity, poor soil & extreme conditions w/ container farms, hydroponic greenhouses, shade houses & farm equipment.

name: Business Continuity and Coastal Preparedness: Technical Capacity Building & Climate Education
highlight: Since 1950 over 63% of the worldwide disasters have hit the Caribbean, with an average estimated damage as a % of GDP of 6x the global average. This training arms the 40 private sector firms with tools to be better prepared and survive a disaster.

name: WIPO (Workshop 1& 2) Blue Economy Business Development Training : Technical Capacity Building & Climate Education
highlight: Caribbean Ocean economy estimate is US$ 407 b. Approx. 30% of CCSA investors are looking for Blue projects.  There are too few or the projects lack readiness, this project aims to grow the regional blue economy and improve its readiness.

name: Develop a Regional Resilience Scorecard (Phase 1 - Beta)
highlight: Developing a scorecard that countries can use to either attract philanthropy to build their resilience, or attract investment as a result of their demonstrated level of resilience.

name: Phase 1: Design of the Caribbean Blended Finance for Resilience (CBFR) Fund
highlight: Caribbean nations need to install 320 MW of RE per year at a cost of $1.2 billion. Only 25 megawatts has been installed in the last nine years. This project helps to increase available funding for solar projects which are low hanging fruit in the region.

name: GrenadaGrows
highlight: Leverages proprietary soil rehabilitation equipment and processes from OL to turn fish waste, chicken waste and biomass (trees/shrubs) into organic soil enhancement products, and as enhanced compost.

name: Kee Farms
highlight: Regenerative ocean farm mitigates climate change via mariculture with seaweed, oysters, sea cucumbers & seagrass. Creates 700 jobs, boosts blue economy, captures 71K tons carbon. Patented activated carbon/biochar processing tech, scalable regionally.

name: DigiFish
highlight: DIGIFISH: Enhancing Ecosystem Approach to Fisheries in the Caribbean via digital tech & data analytics. Boosting fisherfolk & officials' digital literacy for better management & planning. Scaling to multiple countries.

name: Mangrove and Oyster Restoration (MORE)
highlight: Innovative Ecosystem-based Adaptation (EbA) project in Savanna-la-Mar combines mangrove islands & oyster reefs for coastal restoration. Protects against storm surges, improves water quality, engages community for sustainable livelihoods.

name: T-Omega Wind
highlight: T-Omega Wind pioneers ocean-friendly wind turbines, overcoming cost, deep-water deployment, and manufacturing challenges. Floating design, simplified structure, and easy maintenance unlock new markets for affordable clean energy.

name: Strata Sustainability (Ocean box)
highlight: Ocean Box: Mobile recycling plant tackles marine plastics in a sustainable/mobile off grid solution. Eliminates slippage back to waterways, shoreline & oceans, protecting fragile ecosystems & creates a certified, traceable value trail for waste recovery.

name: Bluemvmt
highlight: Bluemvmt: Ocean protection, restoration & commercialization via Subsea Monitoring Platform & Big Data Analytics. Blue/AI generates results, displays insights, predictive analytics and produces alerts based on dynamic and pre-defined thresholds.

name: Community Resilience Program (EC-CREP)
highlight: EC-CREP aims to enhance resilience to extreme weather in OECS, focused on capacity building, targeted engineering, ecosystem-based & socio-economic interventions to reduce community vulnerability & increasing resilience, awareness & best practices sharing

name: OECS Geothermal Energy (OECS GEOBUILD)
highlight: The OECS GEOBUILD project fosters geothermal development via capacity building, policy enhancement, knowledge management, and regional coordination and sharing, aiming for comprehensive transformation in energy uptake.

name: RecycleOECS
highlight: RecycleOECS project is focused on development of a model on sustainable plastic waste management & implementation of 2 demonstration projects & the systems to support it. Aligning with strategic goals for greener economy, resilience, & natural capital.

name: Eastern Caribbean Solar Challenge
highlight: The Eastern Caribbean Solar Challenge, led by NDCFI, aims to boost renewable energy adoption, raise awareness, and foster a Low-Carbon Economic Zone, promoting climate solidarity and action.

name: Resilient Boat Storage Facilities
highlight: Focused on lowering the risk of damage from increasingly intense & more frequent climatic events including high winds & storm surges, this project seeks to develop more robust boat storage facilities at key locations across Dominica on high ground.

name: Green Energy Infrastructure
highlight: Dominica's low carbon strategy drives this project to shift from fossil fuels to solar energy, fostering resilience and energy self-sufficiency. It installs solar panels and batteries in communities, aiming for grid integration and energy credits.

name: Mero Beach Improvements
highlight: This project enhances tourism infrastructure, transforming visitor experiences in Mero Beach while offering income opportunities. With a people-centric approach, adding boutique hotels, guesthouses, restaurants, bars, retail outlets & upgraded facilities.

name: Kalinago Artisinal Fisheries Enhancement
highlight: This project fosters inclusive, sustainable development in the Kalinago Territory. It aims to create safer conditions for fishing, protect boats during severe weather, and promote tourism through traditional fishing and boat building tours.

name: Kalinago Fish Landing Site and Fisherfolk Facility
highlight: The project aims to boost food security & economic prosperity for traditional Kalinago fisherfolk. It includes the development of low impact docks; boat storage; fish processing & cold storage facilities and installation of solar energy for the buildings.

name: Sustainable Tourism Programme
highlight: This project focuses on capturing & analysing data for sustainable tourism. It maps tourism activities, minimizing reef damage, protecting bird populations, and promoting a shift to a Blue Economy through sustainable practices.

name: Hillsborough Fishing Village/Marina Resort
highlight: This initiative aims to boost the local economy by creating a fishing village and tourist destination, supporting multiple industries and jobs. Located in Hillsborough, Grenada, it offers investment opportunities and sustainable job creation.

name: Victoria Ecotourism Centre
highlight: The project aims to establish an ecotourism center in Grenada's Victoria town, featuring guided learning tours exploring the local ecosystem and cultural experiences. Linked to local businesses, it enhances sustainable tourism in the area.

name: Fisheries Centre
highlight: This project aims to create employment, honor local fishing traditions & foster sustainability. It includes facilities for processing, repair & research of marine ecosystems. The data gathered would be used to influence future fishing & ocean initiatives.

name: Pollution Prevention Strategy
highlight: Grenada's pollution mitigation project aims for community education, industry awareness & regulations. It targets solid waste, sewerage, & nonpoint source pollutants, emphasizing coastal & marine health inclusive of mapping for effective intervention.

name: Coastal Erosion Prevention Project
highlight: The Coastal Erosion Prevention project in St Kitts & Nevis aims to safeguard vulnerable ecosystems by erecting boardwalks & shoreline protection structures to minimize erosion, guide foot traffic away from sensitive habitats & promote climate resilience.

name: Coastal and Offshore Renewable Energy Exploration Projects
highlight: This project enhances climate resilience in St Kitts & Nevis by reducing fossil fuel dependency. It offers an opportunity for experienced alternative energy investors to develop coastal & offshore renewable energy assets with wind & solar infrastructure.

name: Bluffs Restoration Project
highlight: St Kitts & Nevis' Bluffs Restoration project promotes enhanced, sustainable tourism while protecting sensitive ecosystems - by stabilizing bluffs with protective railings, it creates hiking trails, lookout points & conservation areas for diverse habitats.

name: Integrated Management of Watersheds and Coastal Areas
highlight: Coastal Management project employs soil stabilization, mangrove restoration, & drainage to improve water quality, food security, & erosion prevention. Infrastructure includes boardwalks, jetties for research, and interpretive signage.

name: Coastal Habitat Restoration Programme
highlight: The Coastal Habitat Restoration program integrates environmental management with ecotourism. It focuses on coral reef restoration, public education, and data collection for sustainable coastal ecosystems.

name: Village Tourism
highlight: This project in Laborie offers an impactful investment opportunity with a boutique hotel, restaurant, and beach bar. It fosters community integration and expands local offerings, promising sustainable livelihoods in an integrated community dispensation.

name: Solar Farm Enhancement
highlight: This initiative will boost St Lucia’s energy independence & contribute to its climate resiliency by expanding the infrastructure of an existing solar farm, developing a solar battery storage facility at LUCELEC’s three-megawatt solar farm.

name: Resilient Fisheries Facilities
highlight: The Choiseul Resilient Fisheries Facility project, enhances local infrastructure to combat climate change's impact. It includes erosion mitigation, sustainable management, solar power, and improved disaster response.

name: Business Accommodation
highlight: Conceptualized as an integrated responsible tourism project, this is an integrated hotel project in Castries which aims to meet the demand for business-oriented accommodation, leveraging the city's bustling port and commercial center.

name: Wind Farm
highlight: The project proposes to advance Saint Lucia’s renewable energy expansion quest through development of a Wind Farm predicated on the erection of wind turbines and ancillary structures.

name: Coastal Protection Infrastructure
highlight: Protecting fragile coastline in Villa, St Vincent & the Grenadines with geotextile boardwalk. Integrating engineered & ecosystem solutions for climate resilience, preserving habitats & preventing erosion.

name: Beach Nourishment
highlight: Mayreau's Beach Nourishment project aims to combat degradation & erosion at Salt Whistle Bay, preserving ecology and infrastructure. It involves strategic rock/infrastructure placement and beach fortification for long-term protection.

name: Aquaculture/Mariculture Facility
highlight: This project aims to diversify the fisheries sector by introducing aquaculture and mariculture, creating new jobs and reducing over-exploitation of native fish species from existing fishing practices..

name: Conversion of Fish Waste to Fertilizer Facility
highlight: This project promotes the circular economy by converting fish waste into organic fertilizer, improving waste management, water quality, and creating new products from ocean by-products like sargassum seaweed.

name: Waterfront Redevelopment
highlight: This project aims to revitalize the Port Elizabeth waterfront in Bequia, Grenadines, following an innovative, community inclusive design. It seeks to enhance tourism, boost the economy, and integrate climate-resilient and sustainable features.

name: Spatial Data Infrastructure to Support Marine Spatial Planning and Ocean Governance (Regional)
highlight: To strengthen data and information systems in the OECS in support of Marine Spatial Planning and Ocean Governance. (Regional)

name: Spatial Data Infrastructure to Support Marine Spatial Planning and Ocean Governance (National)
highlight: To strengthen data and information systems in the OECS in support of Marine Spatial Planning and Ocean Governance. (National)

name: Building Resilience and Mainstreaming a Blue Economy Approach in the Fisheries Sector of OECS Member States (Regional)
highlight: To support a blue economy approach and build resilience through capacity building and enhancing the enabling environment in the fisheries sector (Regional)

name: Building Resilience and Mainstreaming a Blue Economy Approach in the Fisheries Sector of OECS Member States (National)
highlight: To support a blue economy approach and build resilience through capacity building and enhancing the enabling environment in the fisheries sector (National)

name: Building Resilience and Mainstreaming a Blue Economy Approach in the Maritime Sectors of OECS Member States (Regional)
highlight: To support a blue economy approach and build resilience through capacity building and enhancing the enabling environment in the maritime sector (shipping and transportation – including pollution matters, and enforcement and surveillance) (Regional)

name: Building Resilience and Mainstreaming a Blue Economy Approach in the Maritime Sectors of OECS Member States (National)
highlight: To support a blue economy approach and build resilience through capacity building and enhancing the enabling environment in the maritime sector (shipping and transportation – including pollution matters, and enforcement and surveillance) (National)

name: Supporting Blue Economy through Ecological Restoration & Strengthening Management syst for MPAs (Regional)
highlight: To build resilience in coastal and marine ecological systems by undertaking ecological restoration and enhancing existing or establishing new marine protected areas (Regional)

name: Supporting Blue Economy through Ecological Restoration & Strengthening Management syst for MPAs (National)
highlight: To build resilience in coastal and marine ecological systems by undertaking ecological restoration and enhancing existing or establishing new marine protected areas (National)

name: Building Resilience in the OECS through an Enhanced Blue Economy Product (Regional)
highlight: Building Resilience in the OECS through an Enhanced Blue Economy Product (Regional)

name: Building Resilience in the OECS through an Enhanced Blue Economy Product (National)
highlight: Building Resilience in the OECS through an Enhanced Blue Economy Product (National)

name: Exploring Blue Economy Opportunities in the OECS to Facilitate Investment Decisions (Regional)
highlight: To assess the benefits and feasibility of blue economy opportunities in the OECS, and facilitate investment decisions (Regional)

name: Exploring Blue Economy Opportunities in the OECS to Facilitate Investment Decisions (National)
highlight: To assess the benefits and feasibility of blue economy opportunities in the OECS, and facilitate investment decisions (National)

name: Marine Spatial Planning in the OECS for enhanced Cross-border Cooperation (National)
highlight: To improve the efficiency of regulatory processes governing national activities, including cross sectoral boundaries, through marine spatial planning, capacity building and cooperation. (National)

name: Marine Spatial Planning in the OECS for enhanced Cross-border Cooperation (Regional)
highlight: To improve the efficiency of regulatory processes governing national activities, including cross sectoral boundaries, through marine spatial planning, capacity building and cooperation. (Regional)

name: Exploring Marine Energy Potential in the OECS (Regional)
highlight: To strengthen the capacity of the OECS region to develop and use marine renewable energy, and support the increased use of sustainable energy in marine based economic activities.

name: Exploring Marine Energy Potential in the OECS (National)
highlight: To strengthen the capacity of the OECS countries to develop and use marine renewable energy, and support the increased use of sustainable energy in marine based economic activities.

name: Support Blue Bioprospecting and Biotechnology in the OECS (National)
highlight: To strengthen the enabling environment for bioprospecting and biotechnology use, and support ‘blue bioprospecting and biotechnology (National)

name: Support Blue Bioprospecting and Biotechnology in the OECS (Regional)
highlight: To strengthen the enabling environment for bioprospecting and biotechnology use, and support ‘blue bioprospecting and biotechnology (Regional)

name: Promoting a Climate-Risk-Based Approach to Coastal Planning in the OECS (Regional)
highlight: To project anticipated impacts of sea level rise on Eastern Caribbean coastlines, coastal ecosystems and coastal infrastructure and to propose appropriate planning and adaptation responses. (Regional)

name: Promoting a Climate-Risk-Based Approach to Coastal Planning in the OECS (National)
highlight: To project anticipated impacts of sea level rise on Eastern Caribbean coastlines, coastal ecosystems and coastal infrastructure and to propose appropriate planning and adaptation responses. (National)

name: Remote Sensing-Based National Shoreline Assessment and Marine Ecosystem Mapping
highlight: Alcis devised a remote sensing-based methodology to assess shoreline changes, aiding coastal vulnerability planning. Successfully piloted in Timor-Leste, it offers insights to inform adaptation strategies.

name: Heronetta Coral Reef Restoration Pilot Project
highlight: A pilot project proposes Biorock technology to restore coral reefs on Barbados' West Coast, addressing massive coral mortality & ecosystem collapse. Aimed at creating new habitats & combating erosion, it signals a path for coastal restoration in Barbados.

name: Bermuda Regulatory Sandbox
highlight: The sandbox amends the Electricity Act, progressing from testing to commercialization. Prospective developers will still need to secure permissions for commercialization, but their early input allows them to ensure that regulations are properly developed.

name: Solar for Sports
highlight: Installing solar panels, as well as energy conservation measures, on public sports facilities for financial savings to reinvest into sports programs. This also serve as an educational opportunity for children to learn about renewable energy.

name: Deep Seawater Industry (DSI)
highlight: In our flagship project we plan to combine district cooling, via the Zakito district cooling project, with Deep Seawater Industry such as Agriculture and Aquaculture.

name: Vision Zakito
highlight: The WOZ+ envisages a future Zakitó as a vibrant touristic area which is able to meet the needs of visitors including the local population while also considering development possibilities pertaining to conservation & community involvement.

name: ForesightDRM Mobile App andPlatform
highlight: The ForesightDRM platform integrates app and desktop portal for disaster management in agriculture. Crowdsourced data aids in alerts and resources, evolving into a comprehensive mobile and web tool for farmers.

name: Hydroelectric Power Plant
highlight: SC3 proposes a subsea cable project linking Trinidad & Tobago to Guyana, featuring an 800MW hydropower plant. This partnership aims for energy exchange and sustainability, funded as a Public Private Partnership.

name: Climate Smart Scallion Farms
highlight: This project solution introduces hydroponic systems, computerized nutrient injection, and protective agriculture aims to boost crop yield by 40%, reduce growing time by 30%, minimize pest risks by 70%, and enhance overall quality.

name: Carbon Attack Filter
highlight: Commercialization of a low cost, biodegradable, easily retrofitted carbon capture filter for vehicles. It traps all major greenhouse gases & potent pollutants from exhaust which can be used to rehabilitate acidic/dying soil for agriculture/reforestation.

name: Smart Greenhouse Technology
highlight: The 65,000 sq.ft. smart greenhouse is equipped with weather stations & modern sensors. It adapts to climate conditions, optimizes crop protection & ventilation. Utilizing IoT & analytics, it enhances decision-making, reduces labor & optimizes resource use

name: Green or blue energy
highlight: This project initiates a Climate-Safe Infrastructure Working Group to gather standards and frameworks for resilient infrastructure. Stage 1 involves compiling existing guidelines. Stage 2 will survey professionals to assess adaptation requirements..

name: Mushroom Country
highlight: This project diversifies existing composting facility(s) by integrating mushroom production with composting, packaging for Caribbean markets. Utilizing solar panels for energy and capturing biogas for reuse.

name: Sea Cucumber Farming
highlight: PanaSea grows sea cucumbers in a hatchery then  maturing them in the ocean until harvest  A sustainable alternative to the traditional & destructive practice of harvesting wild catch

name: Cayman - Caribbean food security through Climate-Smart Agriculture  (Sony, UNDP, ForkFarms)
highlight: Using innovation to create livelihood opportunities, and a secure and sustainable food supply that adapts to climate change in the Caribbean

name: Open Ocean Aquaculture
highlight: The project will cultivate the American Red Snapper. All required project approvals, industrial sites & permits are obtained. There will be an onshore fingerling hatchery with the farm further away from the shore for a more natural & sustainable habitat.

name: Mahogany Hill
highlight: A $28m initiative creating an eco-friendly residential village in on 18 hectares of land on the Northern Coast. With zoning approval for up to 250 homes, 211 will be built with with solar panels, water recapture, and energy-saving features.

name: Belize Agricultural Sustainable Solutions
highlight: Belize Agricultural Sustainable Solutions (BASS) will combat environmental stress with the Region's first Full Scale Seafood Hydrolysate Production Plant. It offers sustainable solutions for waste management, land & water ecosystems, mitigating pollution.

name: PET Recycling
highlight: SMCL proposes a Bottle-to-Bottle PET recycling facility in Trinidad & Tobago, producing 12,000 MT of rPET resin annually. Aimed at shifting from linear to circular economy, aligning with UN SDGs.

name: Anguilla - Caribbean food security through Climate-Smart Agriculture (Sony, UNDP, ForkFarms)
highlight: Using innovation to create livelihood opportunities, and a secure and sustainable food supply that adapts to climate change in the Caribbean

name: Barbados - Caribbean food security through Climate-Smart Agriculture (Sony, UNDP, ForkFarms)
highlight: Using innovation to create livelihood opportunities, and a secure and sustainable food supply that adapts to climate change in the Caribbean

name: Building Climate Resilience Governance
highlight: To build institutional capacity towards climate action amongst regional and national public sector actors

name: Entrepreneur Support Yardie Divers
highlight: This project merges environmental awareness with marine recreation providing safe, reliable, exciting, informative and affordable services to our clientele.

name: GreenMap and iTrust
highlight: Accelerate deployment of renewable generation in emerging economies by leveraging experience while adding novel financial instruments and developing innovative technology tools.

name: Entrepreneur Support Ja Bio Plastics
highlight: Ja Bio Plastics, winners of NBMC J$2M prize, presents a natural, degradable & compactable alternative to single-use plastic.

name: Methane Gas for Bitcoin Mining
highlight: Methane waste used to power bitcoin mining

name: Gems Agricultural and Wellness Village
highlight: Agrotourism impacting vulnerable youth

name: Eco Skywater
highlight: Sustainable drinking water

name: Seacosystems
highlight: Seacosystems advances Blue Economy with Algae Biorefinery for sustainable biofuel, chemicals, and minerals. Creates jobs, fosters university partnerships, and addresses sargassum/landfill issues

name: Eastern Caribbean Solar Challenge
highlight: ECSC seeks to increase the use and visibility of solar energy in OECS Member States for cost savings, sustainability, and energy resilience through the joint efforts of governments, development partners, the private sector, a local workforce, & households

name: Smart Agriculture with Apiculture
highlight: Greenhouse technology bolstered through the use of precision agriculture, rainwater harvesting and beekeeping, to create a self-sufficient, high yield farm/ecosystem for agricultural produce and associated bee farming products.

name: Sustainable agriculture, agroprocessing and agrotourism and capacity building of communities, farmers and youths
highlight:
Sustainable Earth Farms and Distributors (SEFD) is a climate-smart, sustainable organic farm
which offers rustic, comfortable accommodation, smart & eco-immersive tourism experiences
while building & empowering communities.

name: Project Growlocal: A Climate-smart Agriculture Agribusiness initiative to Slash Dominica’s food Import Bill
highlight: This project will strategically align 10 farmers in Dominica to help them implement a climate-smart agriculture business model to reduce the food import bill and regain market share. The

name: Grow Bahamas Ltd: Phase 1, Start up Project
highlight: The overall goal of this project is to implement a sustainable, low-carbon agricultural food production system for The Bahamas allowing Bahamian artisans and manufacturers to process and scale their businesses.

name: The Ethno-botanical (Eco-lab) project
highlight:
The Ian Douglas Foundation (IDF), the House of Re-Discovery Charity No.1065
(HRD), and the PEG Farm (People Empowerment Growth and Nature Reserve) are
partnering to create and establish a viable prototype Ethno-botanical Eco-lab.

name: REGAL FARMS ASSIST
highlight: Implementation of climate controlled greenhouses for an aeroponic system and aquaponics system in various schools and the women's unit at the Bordelais Correctional Facility.

name: Empowering Communities for Sustainable Change using Containerized Farming and Micro Grids
highlight: The Off-Grid Community-Based Container Farming and Micro grid Initiative aims to transform high electricity theft communities in Jamaica by introducing self-sustained containerized farming units powered by renewable energy.

name: Tea Garden 758 Circular Farm
highlight: Production of Mushrooms, honey, herbs and vegetables using circular farming technique to minimize wastage and use of chemical pollutants.

name: Indoor Climate Resilient and Sustainable Agriculture in Trinidad and Tobago
highlight:
The proposed product being formulated by Impulse Response Enterprises Ltd is
that of an indoor aquaponics farm located in Point Fortin, geared towards the
production of fish (Tilapia and Koi), and short-term vegetable crops.

name: Vetiver Smart Farms
highlight:
This project addresses the increasing climate risks accelerating the degradation of
the agricultural and coastal resources that underpin community livelihoods such as
erosion, soil loss, and land slippage.

name: The ARK Organics Project
highlight: Specializing in the production of organic fertilizers and mulches from goat, sheep, rabbit, and seaweed sources.

name: Honai Beez Apiary
highlight: Honai Beez Apiary is a sustainable beekeeping social enterprise transforming vacant lots into apiaries and green spaces for the conservation of honeybees, to help create awareness for pollinators through education.

name: Student Community Service - Tree Planting
highlight: Empowering & engaging youth and the disabled community in Antigua and Barbuda via tree planting, with employment opportunities, education, and climate action through tree nursery transformation and public-private partnerships.

name: Crissteek Gold Vermicompost
highlight:
Reclaiming Mined-Out Bauxite Lands through Vermicomposting: A Sustainable
Solution for Land Reclamation and Greenhouse Gas Mitigation

name: Electrify 4Sight - An Electrification Project at Jamaica Society for the Blind with a Solar-Powered Aquaponic Greenhouse
highlight: JSB's electrification project with solar aquaponic greenhouse aims to lower energy costs, empower visually impaired, and foster sustainable food production & community.

name: Catalysing urban agriculture for food security, livelihoods and resilience in South East Port of Spain
highlight:
For un/underemployed youth (17- 35 years)
in South East Port of Spain, Trinidad to build their skills and access equipment and
resources to develop their own climate-smart grow box production systems

name: Mouvement pour l’Intégration et l’Émancipation des Femmes Handicapée (MIEFH)
highlight: The "Empowering Food Security and Environmental Resilience through the 'Lakou' Garden and Reforestation Initiative" addresses the pressing challenges facing Northern Haiti due to social, political, and economic crises.

name: Building Resiliency and Food Security through Hydroponics in the Bahamas
highlight: Sustainable agricultural practices while providing workforce development opportunities and greater food security in vulnerable communities.

name: Strengthening the Economic Capacity of Gender Based Violence Victims to Create Sustainable Livelihoods.
highlight: RYVSLU builds agro processing facility, lab, & training center for marginalized women, girls, LGBTQI survivors of GBV in Saint Lucia. Empowers with skills, connects to networks, fosters economic resilience through sustainable livelihoods.

name: Export Barbados (Aquaculture Pilot Project)
highlight: The aquaculture project is aimed at developing technical and academic capacity

name: Bloom Cleantech Cluster
highlight: BIDC's Cluster program shifts focus to the circular economy, targeting carbon emissions reduction & aligning with Barbados' carbon neutrality goals by 2030. It aims to boost local capacity & lobbying efforts while addressing waste management challenges.

name: “Ocean Love NO Plastic NO Waste 2.0” The Path to Scale Up
highlight:
scale up our
successful pilot project "Ocean Love NO Plastic NO Waste", and increase our impact
on plastic waste solutions.

name: Export Barbados Ocean Renewable Wave Energy Project
highlight: A pilot project executed by the Barbados Investment and Development Corporation (BIDC) to establish a Wave Energy Park (WEP) off the Barbados Eastern Coast.

name: Defossilize30 Biofuel
highlight: The Defossilize30 biofuel solution will lower dependency on imported fuels and lower energy prices. Using pre-existing infrastructure.
